sub_topic: Finding the area of a trapezoid.
message_1: A trapezoid has a height of 10 cm and the lengths of its parallel sides are 8 cm and 12 cm. What is the area of the trapezoid?
message_2:
To find the area of a trapezoid, you can use the formula:

Area = (1/2) × (sum of parallel sides) × height

In this case, the parallel sides are 8 cm and 12 cm, and the height is 10 cm. So, the area of the trapezoid is:

Area = (1/2) × (8 + 12) × 10
Area = (1/2) × 20 × 10
Area = 10 × 10
Area = 100 square centimeters
